revised_title: Observations on the Structure of Hyaline Cartilage
tldr: The author, George Thin, demonstrates the laminated structure of hyaline cartilage using nitrate of silver and Bismarck brown staining techniques. The study reveals that the matrix of hyaline cartilage is formed by a series of lamellae parallel to the free surface of the cartilage, and the lamellae are separated from each other near the zone of ossification.
